definition: a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Technical onrush always is billow forward, vast and mighty, cannot hold back.
sentences.chinese: 技术洪流总是滚滚向前，浩浩荡荡，无法阻挡。

sentences.english: Ion Torrent, he added, would “democratize” sequencing.
sentences.chinese: 离子洪流，他补充说，“民主化”的序列。

sentences.english: In places like Ofunato, evacuation areas on higher ground were themselves blasted by the torrents.
sentences.chinese: 在大船渡市，位于高地的疏散中心都被洪流冲毁。

sentences.english: Get ready for a torrent of free services in its wake.
sentences.chinese: 请做好准备，以迎接免费服务洪流的到来。

sentences.english: Starts when is trickle the rivulet, afterward developed the irresistible mighty current.
sentences.chinese: 开始时是涓涓细流，后来发展成势不可挡的洪流。

sentences.english: And Love's flood-tide, in surging waves, is flowing everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 爱的洪流在波浪冲击下流入各处。
涓涓小溪也会成为滚滚洪流。

sentences.english: The precious moments all are lost in the tide, yea.
sentences.chinese: 珍贵的时刻全部遗失于洪流之中。

sentences.english: Else, Torrent Drive users have to keep retrying to start the torrent.
sentences.chinese: 否则，山洪驱动器的用户必须保持重试，开始洪流。

sentences.english: The hidden communications could even be slowly dribbled into the torrent of IP traffic.
sentences.chinese: 隐秘指令甚至可以逐步地混在IP信息的洪流里。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, life has rampaged elsewhere on the Internet's real-time stream.
sentences.chinese: 同时，生活也在互联网的实时洪流中横冲直撞。

sentences.english: But that flood of goods also destroyed entire US industries.
sentences.chinese: 但商品的洪流也摧毁了整个美国工业。

sentences.english: A torrent of water swept down the river.
The mighty torrent rushing through the swirl of history rolled.
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的洪流冲过历史翻卷的漩涡。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
